instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL is another way to say SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL, look at the definition provided for SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL as it applies to .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.C6905: What is C6905? Capacitor to ground on charger input, if this shorts to ground the charger will not put out any power. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.LCD_BKLT_EN: What is LCD_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “LCD_BKLT” which stands for “LCD screen backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.LVDS_DDC_CLK: What is LVDS_DDC_CLK? LVDS_DDC_CLK Is the DDC clock line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .
definitions.LVDS_DDC_DATA: What is LVDS_DDC_DATA? LVDS_DDC_DATA Is the DDC data line between the graphics processor and the screen. DDC is a protocol for identifying a screen so that you know what resolution/refresh rate it wants. This is necessary for screen detection, inductor on this data line must be good and DDC voltage must be going to the LCD screen for it to work. .
definitions.PPVCORE_CPU: What is PPVCORE_CPU? PPVCORE_CPU is an abbreviation of PPVCORE_S0_CPU. When you see someone type PPVCORE_CPU, assume they meant to type PPVCORE_S0_CPU..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , no water damage, no detect battery...
threads.message:
Hello , I have a problem with <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> have short to ground with magsafe connected.....

The macboook pro boot to OSX , but no detect battery.(battery is new).

I have low voltage (with magsafe only) on Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>=0,60V to 0V, I decide to desoldering <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>.

<RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> are Ok
(probably ,because on pdf '' <SIGNAL>K18_820</SIGNAL>-2850 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>'' , <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> display 1 KΩ but they have 2KΩ on board (after desoldering) ).


So <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SCL</SIGNAL> is OK.


[ATTACH]5560._xfImport[/ATTACH]




<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> without magsafe:
[ATTACH]5561._xfImport[/ATTACH]


<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_BSA_SDA</SIGNAL> with magsafe:

[ATTACH]5562._xfImport[/ATTACH]




<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> / ISL 6259!!! replace by new.---------

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , no water damage, no detect battery...
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> short to ground with magsafe, I have desoldering <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>,<DIODE>D7005</DIODE>,(+<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>,<DIODE>D6950</DIODE>).

Pin 5.6.7.8 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> have Short to GND.
I have no idea why <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> have short, I try to follow the pdf, inspected the board.....
I think that the short to gnd is beetween F6905 and <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>(pin 5.6.7.8)+<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> (pin 1.2).
(and desoldering F6905= no short beetwween ''MagSafe DC Power Jack'' and ''Fuse''.

<CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> OK
[ATTACH]5572._xfImport[/ATTACH]





bad SMC?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , no water damage, no detect battery...
threads.message:
[QUOTE="luk812, post: 5639"]OMG.......:(......
Now I realize.
So sorry for my mulimeter (and make you lose time, I hope you have a good laugh !!!)!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Now I never it again, so applied power with multimeter on diode mode..................



**************************************************
************************************************** *****
I resolder the components and make mesures for you see....[/QUOTE]

Multimeters make measurements (simplest form) based on volatge drops across resistive paths. A multimeter trying to measure a drop accross a path that has applied voltage will therefore give you the wrong readings. Google for ohms law and you'll get why. Sorry if you already know this stuff.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , no water damage, no detect battery...
threads.message:
So now <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> was low voltage, I decide to desoldering F7040 (always low voltage)
I desolder <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, and <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>= 17V
Now mesures of resistance around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:


[ATTACH]5690._xfImport[/ATTACH]


So I must replace <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> (1.985Ω)????

replace <RESISTOR>R7015</RESISTOR>(56.5KΩ)?
replace <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>(4.81KΩ)?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , no water damage, no detect battery...
threads.message:
Do not touch <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>!

If <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> if anything over 20 ohms, replace <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> & <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>. 

<RESISTOR>R7015</RESISTOR> is only measuring lower than 220k because there are other items in the circuit around it, do not touch. 

Lastly as always measure voltage between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> when you are done with all of this. Usually between pins 17/18 there is a break from top of the board to bottom of the board on the 2850 that causes problems.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , no water damage, no detect battery...
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> & <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> replace....
I have desoldering  <CAPACITOR>C7015</CAPACITOR> and the capacitance = 1010pF, normaly 470pF...., must I replace too?( all SMD ceramic capacitors around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> are ok except <CAPACITOR>C7015</CAPACITOR> ...)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A , no water damage, no detect battery...
threads.message:
Replace <CAPACITOR>C7015</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> & <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Green light reappear
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:
PIN 17=12.20V
PIN 18=12.20V
PIN 27=16.55V
PIN 28=14.55V

Replace F7040:
green light ok, fan boot ok....

<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>:
PIN 17=12.22V
PIN 18=12.22V
PIN 27=16.70V
PIN 28=16.75V

After few minutes, <SIGNAL>PP3_G3H</SIGNAL> very low...=0.40V.

Green light ok, no fan, no boot now.
